snippet.textDisplay: This game was originally released in Japan as Super Rescue Solbrain and featured different characters based on the TV show, but the most notable difference was Area C which is a Carnival level while in Shatterhand it's a Submarine. The music is also different but both are very solid. A platforming gem for the NES.
snippet.textOriginal: This game was originally released in Japan as Super Rescue Solbrain and featured different characters based on the TV show, but the most notable difference was Area C which is a Carnival level while in Shatterhand it's a Submarine. The music is also different but both are very solid. A platforming gem for the NES.

snippet.textDisplay: Jaleco? Gosh I'm thinking on Rival Turf! By the way Supradarky you had to listen the stage 4 track from Rival Turf, best track in the game.
snippet.textOriginal: Jaleco? Gosh I'm thinking on Rival Turf! By the way Supradarky you had to listen the stage 4 track from Rival Turf, best track in the game.

snippet.textDisplay: This is the best song of the OST and it is missing from the american release. Such a shame. It is also fun to play it on the guitar.
snippet.textOriginal: This is the best song of the OST and it is missing from the american release. Such a shame. It is also fun to play it on the guitar.

snippet.textDisplay: I remember renting this game back in the day. I loved it, ahh the old days when I'd be excited on Friday after school cuz I'd get to go to my favorite local movie rental place and pick a game for the weekend lol.
snippet.textOriginal: I remember renting this game back in the day. I loved it, ahh the old days when I'd be excited on Friday after school cuz I'd get to go to my favorite local movie rental place and pick a game for the weekend lol.

snippet.textDisplay: PRChingon what an innocent, relatable, and nostalgic thought. Cheers for the memories!
